titleStmt.title: James Vanhook to James F. Robinson
CWG7817

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Grundy } Nov 27th 1862.
to the Govenor of the State Ky

I here by resine my office as Jesticee of the peace of District no 12 Pulaski county & desire you to appoint E. S. Salyer or H. Simpson to fill my place I think the said Salyer is the best qualified as he has filled this same office heretofore when he was in office before he was Said to be the best in the county

Pulaski Co
J. P.
Dist No 12

To the Govenor of Kentucky
Frankford
Ky
